attributes.action: Re-open the Croydon Cat Killer Investigation
attributes.additional_details:
25 Post mortem examinations were carried out that further concluded that there was no ‘human involvement’, additionally, lacking CCTV evidence of this. 

It’s fallacious and moronic to assume that the murdered cats were simply the victims of foxes. 

The closure of the investigation will not bring peace to pet owners, but rather it will elicit consternation for many.

The Croydon Cat Killer is likely still out there and the discontinuation of the investigation will jeopardise cats’ lives.
attributes.background: The Met Police ‘confirmed’ that the Croydon Cat Killer doesn’t exist, and further stated that the grotesque mutilations and beheadings of cats were the result of ‘predation or scavenging by wildlife on cats killed in vehicle collisions’.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise.

This is a decision for the Metropolitan Police. You can find out how to complain about a police decision here:

https://www.met.police.uk/advice/advice-and-information/c/complaints/
